channel.title: CVE Feed for n/a -- openvswitch
channel.description: The latest CVEs for n/a -- openvswitch

item.title: CVE-2023-5366|2023-10-06T17:43:34.376Z -- n%2Fa -- openvswitch
item.description: A flaw was found in Open vSwitch that allows ICMPv6 Neighbor Advertisement packets between virtual machines to bypass OpenFlow rules. This issue may allow a local attacker to create specially crafted packets with a modified or spoofed target IP address field that can redirect ICMPv6 traffic to arbitrary IP addresses.

item.title: CVE-2023-1668|2023-11-26T11:06:12.014505 -- n%2Fa -- openvswitch
item.description: A flaw was found in openvswitch (OVS). When processing an IP packet with protocol 0, OVS will install the datapath flow without the action modifying the IP header. This issue results (for both kernel and userspace datapath) in installing a datapath flow matching all IP protocols (nw_proto is wildcarded) for this flow, but with an incorrect action, possibly causing incorrect handling of other IP packets with a != 0 IP protocol that matches this dp flow.

item.title: CVE-2023-3966|2024-02-22T12:15:53.128Z -- n%2Fa -- openvswitch
item.description: A flaw was found in Open vSwitch where multiple versions are vulnerable to crafted Geneve packets, which may result in a denial of service and invalid memory accesses. Triggering this issue requires that hardware offloading via the netlink path is enabled.
